intro: Ardisia zarceroana, commonly known as the Zarcero ardisia, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Myrsinaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are typically clustered in umbels. After flowering, it develops bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ardisia zarceroana is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
